resources.string: Welcome to the Electronic Office of the Real Casa de la Moneda
What certificate do you want to obtain?

The FNMT-RMC, as a Certification Service Provider, makes available to you different types of electronic certificates through which you can identify yourself and carry out procedures securely over the Internet.\n\nDepending on the recipient thereof, the FNMT-RCM issues the following types of digital certificates that you can request through our Electronic OFFICE:

The FNMT Physical Person Certificate, which is issued free of charge to any citizen who holds a DNI or NIE, is the electronic certification issued by FNMT-RCM that links its Subscriber with Signature Verification Data and confirms their personal identity.\n\nThis certificate will allow you to identify yourself electronically and sign or encrypt electronic documents
Representative of Sole or Joint Administrator

Certificate of representative for sole and joint administrators is the electronic certification issued by FNMT-RCM that links a signer with signature verification data and confirms their identity. The signer acts on behalf of a legal person in the capacity of legal representative with their position of sole or joint administrator registered in the Commercial Register
Obtain certificate of Representative of Sole or Joint Administrator

Certificate of representative of legal person is the electronic certification issued by FNMT-RCM that links a signer to signature verification data and confirms their identity. This certificate replaces the one traditionally used by public administrations for the tax field and that, later, was extended for other uses. Therefore, this certificate is issued to legal persons for use in their relations with those public administrations, entities and public bodies, linked or dependent on them.
Obtain certificate of Representative of Legal Person
Representative of Entity without Legal Personality

Certificate of representative of entity without legal personality is the electronic certification issued by FNMT-RCM to an entity without legal personality that links a signer to signature verification data and confirms their identity in tax procedures and other areas admitted by current legislation.
Obtain certificate of Representative of Entity without Legal Personality

Law 40/2015, of October 1, on the Legal Regime of the Public Sector, regulates the identification systems of the Public Administrations, as well as the electronic signature systems of the personnel serving the Public Administrations and the electronic seal for automated administrative action.\n\nIf you wish to use any of the systems provided for in the aforementioned Law 40/2015, and therefore are interested in your Administration having the corresponding agreement with FNMT-RCM for the provision of the same, you can direct your query to comercial.ceres@fnmt.es .

FNMT-RCM also issues electronic certificates for the identification of servers or computer applications inheriting the trust of FNMT-RCM as a Certification Authority. Within this category we make available to you signature certificates and entity seal certificates

The FNMT Digital Certificate for Physical Person is the electronic certification issued by FNMT-RCM that links its subscriber with Verification Data of Signature and confirms their identity.\n\nThis certificate, also known as Citizen or User Certificate, is a digital document that contains your identifying data. It will allow you to identify yourself on the Internet and exchange information with other people and organizations with the guarantee that only you and your interlocutor can access it.
Who can obtain the Physical Person Certificate?
Who can obtain a digital certificate?
Where can I use my certificate?

Any Spanish or foreign citizen, over age or emancipated minor who is in possession of their ID or NIE, can apply for and obtain their digital certificate for free to sign and accredit their identity securely on the Internet.
There are 2 distinct ways to obtain your Physical Person Digital Certificate as a downloadable file on your computer:
With in-person accreditation at an office.
The Physical Person Digital Certificate will allow you to securely perform procedures with Public Administration and Private Entities via the Internet, such as:
Completion of population and housing census data
Consultation and registration in the municipal registry
Consultation and procedures for grant applications
Electronic signature of official documents and forms
Thanks to your FNMT Physical Person Certificate you can forget about unnecessary travel and waiting.

In the following link, some of the services offered to citizens by Organizations and Entities are detailed. \n\nAccessing secure websites requires that the browser from which you access has the certificate installed.
Services offered to citizens by Organizations and Entities

Before beginning the process of applying for your Certificate, you must ensure that your computer has the necessary software installed for key generation. \n\nPlease read and carefully follow the following instructions to avoid possible errors during the certificate obtaining process:
Do not format the computer, between the application and download of the certificate process.
The entire obtaining process must be done on the same computer and by the same user.
It is important to carefully read the Certification Practices Declaration prior to requesting the certificate. The conditions under which certification services are provided are found in it.
Latest version of any of the following browsers:

FNMT-RCM CONFIGURATOR\n\nThe National Mint and Stamp Factory has developed this application to request the necessary keys in obtaining a digital certificate. It can be executed on any browser and operating system.
Once downloaded and installed, the software does not need to be done anything, it will be executed when the browser requires it.
I accept the terms and conditions

NOTICE: Due to the current situation with COVID-19, not all accreditation offices are operating as usual, so it is recommended to contact the relevant agency before going in order to verify that they are still providing this service. We apologize for any inconvenience.

After completing the previous setup (step 1) and submitting your certificate request (step 2), you will possess your Request Code. To continue, the requestor and future certificate holder must personally go to an Identity Accreditation Office to prove their identity.\n\nIf for any reason you are unable to do so, a third party may go on your behalf, but their signature on the contract must be legitimized by a notary beforehand.
More information on signature legitimization by a notary
Can I request a certificate of representation for individuals?
NOTE: Once you have proven your identity at an identity accreditation office, you will be able to immediately download your certificate, so we recommend that you do so as soon as possible.

Only those 18 years or older or emancipated minors will be able to request the certificate. The certificate applicant must present themselves at one of our Identity Accreditation Offices to verify their information using a valid, current, and original form of identification, or, in the absence of this, an officially certified photocopy.
The request code that was sent to their email account and
The National Identity Document (DNI), passport, or driver\'s license.
The request code that was sent to their email account and
National Identification Document for Foreigners showing the NIE, along with passport or identification document from country of origin, or
Union Citizen Certificate showing the NIE, along with passport or identification document from country of origin, or
Official document granting the NIF/NIE, along with passport or identification document from country of origin.
The request code that was sent to their email account and
Red/Green/White Identification Card for Foreigners showing the NIE, along with passport, or
Official document granting the NIF/NIE along with passport.
Where can you verify your identity?
NOTE:This certificate cannot be requested through Post Office offices.
FNMT has enabled more than 2,400 Identity Accreditation Offices throughout the country. You can use our OFFICE LOCATOR service for your convenience.
NOTE: Appointments are required at AEAT, Social Security, and other offices. Please check with the office directly.

If you are abroad, you can go to the Spanish Consular Career Offices abroad. However, it is not possible at Customs offices. You can check the Spanish Consular Offices abroad where you can obtain the certificate for individuals.

To download the certificate, you must use the same computer and the same user as the one used for the Request and enter the required information exactly as it was entered then. To download and install your certificate, enter the following information:

La FNMT-RCM emite tres tipos de certificados de representante que son cualificados de acuerdo al Reglamento (UE) Nº 910/2014, del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo, de 23 de julio de 2014, relativo a la identificación electrónica y los servicios de confianza para las transacciones electrónicas en el mercado interior.\n\nImportante: Los representantes que sean administrador único/solidario de la entidad NO deben solicitar certificado de representante de persona jurídica. Deben solicitar el certificado de administrador único o solidario.
Ayuda: ¿Que certificado de representación debo solicitar?

El Real Decreto Legislativo 1/2010, de 2 de julio, por el que se aprueba el texto refundido de la Ley de Sociedades de capital, establece, en su artículo 210, que 'la administración de la sociedad se podrá confiar a un administrador único, a varios administradores que actúen de forma solidario o de forma conjunta o a un consejo de administración'.

Por tanto, administrador único será, como su propio nombre indica, cuando existe un solo administrador. Por su parte, administrador solidario puede darse cuando, existiendo más de un administrador, estos no son mancomunados. Administrador solidario es aquél que puede tomar las decisiones por sí solo, sin necesitar la concurrencia de voluntad del resto de administradores. En consecuencia, administrador mancomunado será aquél que requiere el consentimiento o la firma del resto de administradores para poder ejercer sus funciones.

Este certificado se expide a los administradores únicos o solidarios como representantes de las personas jurídicas para sus relaciones con las administraciones públicas y en la contratación de bienes o servicios propios o concernientes a su giro o tráfico ordinario.

Este certificado puede ser obtenido por: sociedades anónimas (A) y limitadas (B) si el representante de la sociedad es administrador único o solidario inscrito correctamente en el Registro Mercantil.
Solicitar Certificado de Representante para Administrador Único o Solidario

Se expide a las personas físicas como representantes de las personas jurídicas para su uso en sus relaciones con las Administraciones públicas, entidades y organismos públicos, vinculados o dependientes de las mismas.
Solicitar Certificado de Representante para Persona Jurídica

Se expide a las personas físicas como representantes de las entidades sin personalidad jurídica en el ámbito tributario y otros previstos en la legislación vigente.\n\nEste certificado se expide a las personas físicas como representantes de las entidades sin personalidad Jurídicas para su uso en sus relaciones con aquellas Administraciones Públicas, Entidades y Organismos Públicos, vinculados o dependientes de las mismas.
Solicitar Certificado de Representante para Entidad sin Personalidad Jurídica
Agilizar y abaratar gestiones con la Administración Pública.
Aumento de la productividad y competitividad de la empresa.
Simplificación y automatización de la gestión documental.
Reducción de errores al eliminar precedimientos manuales.
Favorecer la eliminación de documentos impresos.
Dar cumplimiento a las obligaciones legales.
Obtener certificado de Representante para Administrados Único o Solidario

Este certificado puede ser obtenido por: sociedades anónimas (A) y limitadas (B) si el representante de la sociedad es administrador único o solidario, tenga inscritas sus facultades de Representación en el Registro Mercantil y éstas no hayan sido revocadas. En dicho Registro tiene que constar el NIF actual de la Entidad, el órgano de administración, el NIF o NIE correcto (9 caracteres) del administrador único o solidario, el cargo específico (administrador único o administrador solidario), fecha de nombramiento, duración del cargo (vigente o indefinida), inscripción y fecha de inscripción.\n\nIMPORTANTE: Este certificado NO puede ser solicitado por administradores mancomunados, apoderados, consejeros, presidentes, administradores conjuntos, liquidadores ni sociedades que tengan como administrador a otra sociedad, debiendo en estos casos solicitar un certificado de representación de persona jurídica.
Ayuda: ¿Qué certificado de representación debo solicitar?

El proceso de obtención del certificado de representante para administradores únicos y solidarios se divide en tres pasos, que deben realizarse en el orden señalado:

1 - Configuración previa. Para solicitar el certificado es necesario instalar el software que se indica en este apartado.

2 - Solicitud vía internet de su Certificado. Este certificado sólo puede pedirse de forma On Line con un certificado de Persona Física de la FNMT-RCM o DNI electrónico.

3 - Descarga de su Certificado. Aproximadamente 1 hora después de que haya solicitado su certificado y haciendo uso de su Código de Solicitud, desde aquí podrá descargar e instalar su certificado, así como realizar el pago y realizar una copia de seguridad (RECOMENDADO).

El precio de este certificado es de 24 Euros, impuestos no incluidos, y se emite con un periodo de validez de 2 años.

Sólo se admite el pago con tarjetas de crédito/débito.

Si lo desea puede adquirir un kit lector+tarjeta criptográfica para dotar a su certificado de mayor seguridad de uso y custodia. Cuando descargue su certificado podrá hacer una copia de seguridad e importarlo a la tarjeta. .
